thread.title: Flyers' Giroux thought Raffl was 'joking around' after collapsing on bench
thread.title_full: Flyers' Giroux thought Raffl was 'joking around' after collapsing on bench

author: Colorado theater shooter James Holmes assaulted in prison
title: Flyers' Giroux thought Raffl was 'joking around' after collapsing on bench
text:
Flyers' Giroux thought Raffl was 'joking around' after collapsing on bench theScore 6 hrs ago © Derik Hamilton-USA TODAY Sports A chilling incident occurred during the Philadelphia Flyers' shootout win over the New York Rangers on Saturday as forward Michael Raffl passed out on the bench after colliding with Jarret Stoll on his previous shift.
AdChoices Claude Giroux was sitting beside his teammate when he collapsed and the captain thought Raffl, who's described as the team's "class clown" by Randy Miller of NJ.com , was just fooling around.
"Michael is a funny guy and sometimes he does something funny," Giroux said. "I (thought) he was joking around.
"I told him to move. Then I realized he wasn't joking around. Then I started freaking out and started yelling at (athletic trainer) Jimmy (McCrossin). It wasn't a fun moment. The whole team was pretty worried."
Fortunately, Raffl was well enough to walk into the dressing room and tell his teammates he was "fine" during the second intermission. The Flyers are calling it an upper-body injury.
